1 import time
2 
3 class BoardPid:
4 
5  """ Implementation of PID
6  """
7 
8  def __init__(self,
9  kp=0, # proportional gain
10  ki=0, # integral gain
11  kd=0, # derivative gain
12  target=0, # target value
13  derivative_window=1, # number of previous calls to average error change rate over
14  timeout=None, # optionally sets a timeout which resets integral error if exceeded
15  int_max=None, # optionally sets a maximum integral error, to prevent wind-up
16  out_max=None, # optionally sets a maximum controller output
17  in_max=None,
18  halt_out=0
19  ):
20 
21  """
22  Initialization function
23  INPUTS:
24  kp=0 ~ proportional gain
25  ki=0 ~ integral gain
26  kd=0 ~ derivative gain
27  target=0 ~ target setpoint
28  derivative_window=1 ~ previous calls over which to average derivative
29  timeout=None ~ timeout to reset integral
30  int_max=None ~ maximum integral
31  out_max=None ~ maximum output
32  in_max=None ~ maximum input
33  halt_out=0 ~ "rest" output
34  OUTPUTS:
35  PID object
36 
37  """
38 
39  # sets PID coefficients
40  self.kp = kp
41  self.ki = ki
42  self.kd = kd
43 
44  # inits controller values
45  self.int = 0
46  self.target = target
47  self.err_last = 0
48  self.last_time = time.time()
49  self.edot_hist = [0]*derivative_window
50  self.timeout=timeout
51  self.int_max = int_max
52  self.out_max = out_max
53  self.in_max = in_max
54  self.halt_out = halt_out
55 
56  def get(self, val):
57 
58  """
59  Gets PID output
60  INPUTS:
61  val ~ current process sensor value
62  OUTPUTS:
63  out ~ actuator output
64 
65  """
66 
67  # Gets new output based on current sensor
68 
69  # Halts if position is out of range
70  if not self.in_max is None:
71  if val > self.in_max or val < -self.in_max:
72  return self.halt_out
73 
74  # get timestep since last controller call
75  cur_time = time.time()
76  dt = cur_time - self.last_time
77  self.last_time = cur_time
78 
79  # get new error between current sensor value and target
80  err = self.target-val
81 
82  # update integral of error assuming error changes linearly between calls
83  self.int = self.int+(err*dt)/2
84 
85  # if a maximum integral error is set, makes sure maximum integral error is not
86  # exceeded to prevent windup
87  if not self.int_max is None:
88  self.int = min(self.int_max, max(-self.int_max, self.int))
89 
90  # if maximum timestep is set and exceeded, resets integral error to prevent
91  # large integral errors
92  if not self.timeout is None:
93  if dt > self.timeout:
94  self.int = 0
95 
96  # calculates error change rate since last controller call
97  derr = (err-self.err_last)/dt
98 
99  # averages error change rate over last n controller calls to smooth velocity
100  self.edot_hist.pop(-1)
101  self.edot_hist.insert(0, derr)
102  edot = sum(self.edot_hist)/len(self.edot_hist)
103 
104  # stores current error for comparison in next controller call
105  self.err_last = err
106 
107  # calculates PID value
108  out = self.kp*err + self.ki*self.int + self.kd*edot
109 
110  # if maximum output is set, clamps output so that the maximum output is not exceeded
111  if not self.out_max is None:
112  out = min(self.out_max, max(-self.out_max, out))
113 
114  # returns controller values
115  return out
116 
117  def set_target(self, target):
118  """
119  Sets PID target
120  INPUTS:
121  target ~ new target
122  OUTPUTS:
123  none
124  """
125  self.target = target # sets new target setpoint
126 
127  def set_gains(self, kp=None, ki=None, kd=None):
128  """
129  Sets PID gains
130  INPUTS:
131  kp=None ~ proportional gain
132  ki=None ~ integral gain
133  kd=None ~ derivative gain
134  OUTPUTS:
135  none
136  """
137  if not kp is None:
138  self.kp = kp
139  if not ki is None:
140  self.ki = ki
141  if not kd is None:
142  self.kd = kd
143
